observation: I can see a language selection modal has opened with many language options. There are two columns of languages available, with English selected/highlighted at the top of both columns. I need to select English to proceed with the registration flow.
reasoning: As an elderly user, I want to keep things simple and use English which I'm most comfortable with. I can see English is already highlighted in the first column (element 2), so I should select it to continue.
ux_issues: Language selection modal appeared unexpectedly after country selection
Too many language options displayed at once could be overwhelming for elderly users

outcome.visual_observation: The action had no visible effect. Both BEFORE and AFTER screenshots show identical content - same country/region selection screen with 'United States' search field and 'No result found' message. No progression in sign-up flow occurred.
outcome.diagnosis: The tap on English language option did not trigger any navigation or UI changes. This could be due to: 1) The language selector being non-functional, 2) JavaScript event handlers not properly attached, 3) The element not being properly clickable, or 4) A backend service failure preventing language selection processing.
